intro: Galearis rotundifolia f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed round-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a rounded base and a narrow, tapering tip, giving it a distinctive appearance. This plant is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It is a perennial herb that blooms in early summer, contributing to the floral diversity of its native regions.
